reviews.review_msg: Such a good prof, he really makes what could be super hard material easy to understand! Makes lectures interesting & easy to follow!
This course is not easy and requires a lot of work but Pete makes this course very enjoyable.

PRetty tough course but if you put your time into it you can manage at least a B. As far as Pete goes, he Is the best professor ive taken so far at sfu. Brilliant professor who keeps class very interesting with his stories especially the ones from wrestling. Id come to this class pretty hung over and i managed a B, but i studied hard. SICK GUY!!

Awesome prof. Very clear explanations and keeps a difficult course interesting. Bring a laptop to lecture if you can because it is NONSTOP notes. He's also super cool and tells funny stories every class. Definitely recommend!

THIS IS THE COOLEST PERSON YOU WILL EVER MEET... hes super nice and makes a difficult course fathomable. I encourage anyone who has the opportunity to take a class with him to take it. The man is super smart, chill, and inspiring. this is the man

Best professor I have had so far. Super helpful. Like others said, there are only two exams and the tutorials. He uses lots of examples and even movie clips to illustrate points which are very helpful.The course itself is challenging, but he makes it worth it.

Pete is the best teacher I've had at SFU. He is passionate about the material and he incorporates entertaining examples to support his teachings. His notes are incredible...o and he allows a cheat sheet for the midterm/final. It is a super tough course but incredibly interesting!!!
Best. Prof. Ever. He makes criminal law so interesting. A lot of note taking, but totally worth it.
Very knowledgeable and well versed in criminal law. His lectures are 2 hours of straight note taking. Learned alot from him this semester. His exams are quite difficult and time constrained.

Very clear and precise. LOTS of notes and lots of memorization, but it's fairly interesting. He gives lots of example cases to help. Midterm only counts if you do worse on the final. No papers, just two exams and tutorial.
